title: f1 key brightness controls both f1/f2 brightness levels
body: f2 key brightness does not work (this may be a limitation idk?)
author: ssjshields

comments.body: Unfortunately the Led controller doesn't have an interface to set brightness for both buttons seperately. Both leds listen to brightness controls set to F1.  I need to update the UI to reflect this more clearly
Honestly this limitation is fine, maybe just hide the setting for F2 and make it clearer for F1

title: Some LED selected don't show the color from the selection
body: Certain LED color selection don't translate to the actual LED.  An example of this is the GREEN LED sub-colors.  Either the LED color doesn't change or the color is not what is represented.  Tested on TRIMUI BRICK with MinUI OS
author: cepfromca

comments.body:
Unfortunately the leds in these devices are just cheap uncalibrated ones. I do sent the right color code but it sometimes just isn't translated well by the controller/leds themselves. 

Its basically also why for example Philips Hue costs 60 per bulb and some chinese alternatives costs 10. 

There's a huge difference between leds when it comes to color reproduction and light accuracy etc.

title: Feature Request - Ability to turn off LED
body: It looks like the only way to "turn off" a LED area is to set it to BLACK.  Maybe add an effect as DISABLED?  You mentioned that you are working on additional effects, so maybe this in the works.  Tested on TRIMUI BRICK - MinUI OS
author: cepfromca

comments.body: Brightness control is there which you can set to 0 if that is what you mean?

I am currently using setting the color to black, which doesn't seem to turn on the LED.  Setting the brightness to zero would accomplish the same thing, though I think both options still has the LED "on" in some capacity, but maybe I am wrong about that.  My thought was about a setting that disabled certain LED, so they would be considered "off"
Are you sure its not just light shining through from the other leds? If I set brightness to 0 on mine they are completely off.

If that is the expected behaviour, then this can be closed.  I switched to using the brightness setting instead of setting the LED to black which also doesn't light up the LED (but not sure if the LED is actually off doing that)

title: MinUI on BRICK - LED only turn on during sleep
body: After setting the configuration, LED don't turn on.  If the device is put into sleep, the configured LED light up in the settings specified.  Waking up the device turns the LED back off
author: cepfromca

comments.body: This is solved in latest v3.0 release :)
